definition.core: Represents the individual's default and fallback strategies when encountering conflict, tension, disagreement, or threat to needs or identity. Reveals escalation tendencies, avoidance patterns, and stress-driven behaviors.

axes.fight_orientation: Confronts conflict directly; escalates to regain control or assert boundaries.
axes.flight_orientation: Withdraws or disengages to reduce tension; avoids confrontation.
axes.freeze_orientation: Pauses, becomes indecisive, mentally overloaded, or emotionally shut down under conflict.
axes.fawn_orientation: Attempts to restore harmony through appeasement, compliance, or over-accommodation.

behavioral_markers: predictable escalation or retreat patterns under relational stress
consistency in how boundaries are defended or avoided
conflict strategies tied to perceived threat intensity
distortion or rigidity in communication when stakes feel high
